intro: Elephantopus spiralis, commonly known as the spiral elephantiopus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, spiraling stems with small, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in dense clusters that bloom in the summer months. Elephantopus spiralis is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
